SENTENCE.STRING: (pronunciation /[IPA: dʒənivə]/; French: Genève /[IPA: ʒənɛv]/, German: Genf /[IPA: gɛnf]/, Italian: Ginevra) is the second most populous city in Switzerland (after Zürich), and
is the most populous city of Romandy (the French-speaking part of Switzerland).
is situated where Lake Geneva (French Lac Léman) flows into the Rhône River, and
is the capital of the Canton of Geneva.
The population within the city limits is 185,526 (2004) and that of the metropolitan area — which extends into France and Vaud — is about 700,000.
is widely regarded as a global city, mainly due to the presence of numerous international organizations, including the European headquarters of the United Nations.
to have the second highest quality of living in the world (again, after Zürich).
See Names of European cities in different languages for a list of the name of
